settings.editor: The BNWYF was informally proclaimed in 2019 with the vision to connect a diverse group of engaged individuals both from Bangladesh and the Netherlands who has a vested interest in water science. We work not only to to create opportunities for water professionals, but also to strengthen the bond between the two countries. Through this platform young professionals gets various opportunities to share their knowledge and expertise of the water science domain and work together to deliver sustainable solutions to future water-related problems.

tabs.tab_title: Diplomatic Relation netween Bangladesh & the Netherlands
tabs.tab_content: Bangladesh and The Netherlands established diplomatic relations in 1971 after the independence. The Netherlands has been supporting Bangladesh through providing Technical Assistance to water resources and coastal management projects. Since both the countries are located in delta regions and share similar coastal landscape, many mutual lessons can be learned. The Netherlands has helped in the Delta Development Project of Bangladesh in 1976 and currently contributing in the implementation of major projects like CEIP and BDP2100.

Bangladesh-Netherlands Water Youth Forum (BNWYF) was informally proclaimed in 2019 with the vision to connect a diverse group of engaged individuals from Bangladesh and the Netherlands who has a vested interest in water science.
To expand into a broader network with the single motivation to grow the importance of water as a catalyst for community building and adapting to the needs of our future.

Through BNWYF we want to unite young professionals both from Bangladesh and the Netherlands. This will not only strengthen the bond between the two countries, but most importantly using this platform young professionals can share their knowledge and expertise, work together in many problems, and deliver sustainable solutions to future water-related problems.
